name: SAPA
mission: Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a not-for-profit, scientific professional, non-partisan, and humanitarian membership-based organization established in January 2019
theoryOfChange: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) has a documented strategic approach to its work. Their strategy is described as a "comprehensive, holistic approach to healthcare delivery" aimed at ensuring vulnerable groups, particularly women and children, receive accessible and quality healthcare. SAPA's overarching humanitarian goals include ensuring access to essential healthcare services, preventing and controlling communicable diseases, providing food assistance, supporting health facilities, strengthening local healthcare worker capacity, and fostering collaboration among humanitarian organizations. Their programming framework includes pillars such as Direct Health Service Delivery, Health System Resiliency, WASH, Food and Nutrition, and Protection, designed to increase disaster response capacity and build resilience. A Mid-2024 Report outlines a "framework for SAPA's programming moving forward" with an overarching goal for all targeted individuals to "survive and thrive" by 2026, benefiting from early nurturing, care, education, and reliable access to high-quality health and nutrition interventions. SAPA also implements a quality assurance framework that includes staff training, supervision, regular reporting, and partner-supported logistics. The organization's commitment to transparency regarding its goals, strategies, and achievements is further evidenced by its 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid.

evaluationSources: 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

score_details.score_summary: Sudanese American Physicians Association shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SAPA holds a 97.0/100 score with a program expense ratio of 81.2% and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
The organization provides specific donation options for supporters to contribute.
SAPA is zakat-eligible and maintains a formal zakat policy for its programs.
SAPA reported total revenue of $3,502,228 and operates healthcare, emergency services, and hunger relief programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient fundraising, and direct impact on urgent global health crises. Its zakat eligibility and high program spending make it a highly aligned choice for humanitarian-focused donors.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding the duration of working capital beyond 4.3 months to enhance long-term sustainability

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment with donor interests through its focus on urgent global health needs and its status as a zakat-eligible entity [3]. SAPA provides clear pathways for zakat contributions, ensuring funds are distributed according to established policy [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAPA demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of medical services and hunger relief, maintaining a program expense ratio of 81.2% [1][4]. The organization operates with high efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1, and reported a total revenue of $3,502,228 to support its mission [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides emergency relief to communities facing crisis in Sudan and neighboring regions.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.2% ensures the majority of funds reach those in need
Strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100
Verified zakat-eligible status for Muslim donors
baseline_narrative.summary: SAPA works with local health providers and institutions to build resilient healthcare functions capable of responding to humanitarian emergencies [4]. The organization operates critical programs including healthcare services in Chad and Sudan, hunger relief, and emergency medical interventions [4].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency, efficient fundraising, and direct impact on urgent global health crises. Its zakat eligibility and high program spending make it a highly aligned choice for humanitarian-focused donors.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks outcomes, it currently lacks detailed beneficiary data to calculate cost-per-beneficiary metrics, which would strengthen its evidence base.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB assessment data is not currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains exceptional financial health and a 81.2% program expense ratio, mitigating concerns about resource waste.
risk_factors: Missing detailed beneficiary counts for cost-effectiveness analysis
Rapid growth (263.1% CAGR) may strain operational capacity if not managed carefully
case_against.summary: The primary limitation for SAPA is the lack of granular cost-per-beneficiary data.

confidence.data_freshness: Data from 2023 Form 990 and recent audits
confidence.notes: Strong financial and rating data available.

alignment.explanation: The organization is an excellent fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="3">zakat-eligible programs</cite> that serve vulnerable populations in <cite id="4">Sudan and Chad</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAPA due to its <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, its PLATINUM Seal of Transparency from Candid, and its publication of <cite id="5">audited financial statements</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed annual impact reports with independent evaluations.

impact.explanation: SAPA delivers highly efficient operations with a <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> and a strong fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but missing cost-per-beneficiary data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides emergency relief to communities facing crisis in Sudan and neighboring regions.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide urgent, highly efficient medical and humanitarian relief to crisis-affected populations in Sudan and Chad while fulfilling their zakat obligations.
donor_motivations: Want to support healthcare infrastructure in conflict zones
Prioritize organizations with exceptional financial efficiency (100.0% program ratio)
giving_considerations: The organization is relatively young (founded 2019) but growing rapidly
Operates in highly volatile regions where access can be challenging
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with decades of history or those requiring rigorous academic RCT evidence of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks outcomes and has a documented theory of change, but lacks the detailed beneficiary data required for rigorous cost-effectiveness analysis.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAPA builds core functions of healthcare systems to respond to crises through direct medical services, WASH programs, and hunger relief.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions are not only delivered but are effectively improving health outcomes in crisis zones.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a 263.1% revenue CAGR and ongoing crises in Sudan, the organization has significant capacity to absorb and deploy additional funds.

peer_comparison.differentiator: SAPA distinguishes itself with a <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite>, well above the <cite id="1">peer program ratio median of 85.2%</cite>.
peer_comparison.peer_group: Global Health and Humanitarian Relief Organizations

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">81.2% of its expenses to programs</cite>, maximizing the direct impact of donor contributions on healthcare services.
SAPA maintains a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, alongside a PLATINUM Seal of Transparency from Candid.
The charity provides <cite id="3">zakat-eligible giving options</cite> to support vulnerable populations in crisis zones.

strengths_deep_dive: SAPA demonstrates remarkable financial efficiency and growth. The organization achieved a <cite id="4">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>, indicating rapidly expanding capacity to meet urgent humanitarian needs. Its commitment to maximizing impact is evidenced by its <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite>, which significantly outperforms the <cite id="1">peer program ratio median of 85.2%</cite>. Additionally, the organization maintains strong governance with a <cite id="4">12-member board</cite> and has secured <cite id="5">audited financial statements</cite> to ensure transparency.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a dedicated humanitarian organization that was <cite id="4">founded in 2019</cite> to strengthen healthcare systems and provide emergency relief to communities facing crisis. The organization focuses its efforts on critical regions, specifically operating in <cite id="4">Chad, Sudan, and the United States</cite>. SAPA works directly with local health providers and institutions to build the core functions of a healthcare system that is prepared to respond to humanitarian emergencies. In its recent fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="4">$3,502,228 in total revenue</cite>, demonstrating significant growth and capacity to deliver aid. The charity is highly efficient, dedicating <cite id="4">100.0% to program expenses</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions directly support medical missions, hunger relief, and water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) programs. Furthermore, SAPA has earned a <cite id="1">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting exceptional financial health and accountability. For Muslim donors, SAPA offers <cite id="3">verified zakat-eligible programs</cite>, making it a strong choice for fulfilling religious giving obligations while supporting urgent global health initiatives.
